definition: market/store/mall (usually specializing in a particular product category such as furniture)
to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams

sentences.english: Yet the superstore trend is relatively new to China.
sentences.chinese: 然而，在中国大卖场是相对新的发展潮流。

sentences.english: Unique design, comprihensive top furniture supermarket, leading the new fashion of furniture consumption.
sentences.chinese: 匠心独具，百货式高端家居卖场，引领消费新潮流。

sentences.english: A large one-stop merchandiser will be built here next year.
sentences.chinese: 明年这里将建成一个大型的一站式大卖场。

sentences.english: There's no better place to look than Mongkok's mobile phone mall.
sentences.chinese: 没有哪个地方比得上旺角的手机卖场。

sentences.english: The more large - scale stores open more road building material shop alone is not a competitive advantage.
sentences.chinese: 大型卖场越开越多，马路建材单店根本没有竞争优势。

sentences.english: It will be a large church wedding.
sentences.chinese: 明年这里将建成一个大型的一站式大卖场。

sentences.english: My uncle was selling vegetables at the market last summer.
sentences.chinese: 我叔叔去年夏天在大卖场卖菜。

sentences.english: He used to bid at the auction.
sentences.chinese: 过去，他常去拍卖场出价竞买。

sentences.english: This would clear the stocks from the auction platforms forcing the traders to offer better price.
sentences.chinese: 这将清掉拍卖场的存货，迫使贸易商提供更好的价格。

sentences.english: Take Wal-Mart ( WMT- news -people ), which hasclean, well-organized aisles in its hypermarkets.
sentences.chinese: 拿沃尔玛为例，它的超级大卖场干净，布置有序。

sentences.english: I never shopped in an outlet before.
sentences.chinese: 我从来没有逛过出清大卖场。

sentences.english: The mainland Chinese are beginning to dominate the salerooms.
sentences.chinese: 中国大陆买家开始在拍卖场显现优势。

sentences.english: Ted bid fifty dollars for the old PDA at the auction.
sentences.chinese: 泰德在拍卖场中出价五十元买那旧型的个人数位助理。

sentences.english: The retailer plans to reopen its Chongqing stores on Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 沃尔玛计划于下周二重新开放位于重庆的卖场。

sentences.english: Initially, only five export houses were participating at the auctions.
sentences.chinese: 最初，拍卖场仅有五个出口公司参与交易。

definition: shopping mall/shopping center/department store/emporium/CL:家[jia1]/the business world
brick and mortar business/physical (rather than online) retail store
supermarket/abbr. for 超級市場|超级市场/CL:家[jia1]
